hanzi-su-wiki:
崎

Значения

Мыс

Мнемоника

Странная 奇 гора 山 — слишком неровная и обрывистая.

Варианты

﨑, 嵜‎, 㟢, 埼, 碕
purpleculture_pinyin:
qí
mountainous
горный
rtega_mnemonic:
埼埼RS崎㟢嵜碕﨑𥔎 headland, cape, spit, promontory
  • earth 土 or mountain 山 sticking out so much everyone talks about it 奇 and comes visiting
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 奇 indicates the sound; 山 (mountain) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
崎岖 [ qí qū ]: rugged; craggy
山崎 [ shān qí ]: Yamazaki or Yamasaki (Japanese surname)
崎岖不平 [ qí qū bù píng ]: rugged and rough; bumpy (idiom)
川崎 [ chuān qí ]: Kawasaki (name)
长崎 [ cháng qí ]: Nagasaki, Japan
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 山 [ shān ] mountain, hill, peak
    • 奇 [ qí ] strange, unusual, odd; uncanny, occult
heisig_chinese_memo: The strange mountain people can be found in many countries and always look a bit more rugged than the normal city people.
heisig_constituent: promontory, mountain, strange, large, St. Bernard, can, street, nail, spike, mouth
heisig_story: Mountain . . . strange. Hint: you might save yourself the trouble of a story here simply by recalling the kanji for cape (Frame 164) and toying around with the differing images suggested by the key words promontory and cape.
koohiiStory1: This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with mountain in place of soil. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives stone and strange. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which promontory is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names.
koohiiStory2: A promontory is a small, strange mountain that juts out into the sea.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: On top of a big mountain, wearing a lip ring, you see a cape jutting out into the ocean. You’re wearing a lip ring because you’re a cool and edgy guy who likes to climb big mountains. From the top of the big mountain, you see a cape.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You’re tired from just climbing up the big mountain but the view is worth it. Feel the wind blustering around you as you take in the beautiful scenery, including the cape.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Atop the big mountain overlooking the cape, you start to play what you call hacky sacky (さき). Most people say hacky sack, but you’re edgy and cool and have a lip ring so you say sacky instead.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: See yourself doing your hacky sacky thing on top of this big mountain. Concentrate to keep the hacky sacky in the air as it’s a long way down.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 口 (рот), 大 (большой), 山 (гора)
Ru_trainchinese: qí: (графема) горный, гористый (не используется в одиночку)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the strange (奇) mountain (山) is a headland
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The strange mountain people can be found in many countries and always look a bit more rugged than the normal city people.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " mountain " to the " strange " sound. " Saki " means a sideways appearance. "Guang Ya. Shi Xun: "Rugged, leaning sideways." Wang Niansun's testimony: "Rough and rugged are sideways." Such as Song Yu of the Warring States Period (Gao Tang Fu): "The rock is steep and the cliffs are steep." Wang Bao <Nine Huai. "Zhao Shi"": "Suddenly turning back to the west, seeing the Qiqiu Qiqi."

"Rugged" describes uneven mountain roads. "Jade articles. "Mountain": "Rugged, rugged, uneven mountain roads." Such as "The Latent." "Floating": "The husband-in-law Ziyu Zhang, who traveled far and wide, was born in a deep mountain and poor valley, experienced mountain cens, and stood a thousand steps high, a stream of hundreds of meters, lean on dangers, rugged and inconvenient" Eastern Jin Tao Yuanming "Return Ci>: "It is not only slender to find trenches, but also rugged and passing through the hills." See " rugged ".

"Rugged" by extension means distress and experiencing difficulties. Such as "Historical Records. "Yanzhao Gong Family": "The Yan Zhaogong forced the wild raccoon outside, the internal measures were Qi, Jin, the rugged and strong country leisure, the weakest, and there are countless ones." Tang Dynasty Bao Fang "Inquiry about Jintai Fu": "Fuchuan Land Difficulties Risk, compassion for the ruggedness of the world."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " mountain " to the " strange " sound. " Saki " means a sideways appearance.
humanum_full_description:
從「山」，「奇」聲。「崎」表示傾側貌。《廣雅．釋訓》：「崎嶇，傾側也。」王念孫疏證：「崎與嶇皆傾側貌也。」如戰國宋玉〈高唐賦〉：「磐石險峻，傾崎崖隤。」《楚辭．王褒〈九懷．昭世〉》：「忽反顧兮西囿，睹軫丘兮崎傾。」

　　「崎嶇」形容山路不平。《玉篇．山部》：「崎，崎嶇，山路不平。」如《潛夫論．浮侈》：「夫檽梓豫章，所出殊遠，又乃生於深山窮谷，經歷山岑，立千步之高，百丈之谿，傾倚險阻，崎嶇不便」東晉陶淵明〈歸去來辭〉：「既窈窕以尋壑，亦崎嶇而經丘。」參見「嶇」。

　　「崎嶇」引申表示困厄、經歷險阻。如《史記．燕召公世家》：「燕外迫蠻貉，內措齊、晉，崎嶇彊國之閒，最為弱小，幾滅者數矣。」唐代鮑防〈問津臺賦〉：「撫川陸之難險，憫人世之崎嶇。」
humanum_short_description: 從「山」，「奇」聲。「崎」表示傾側貌。

從「 山 」，「 奇 」聲。「 崎 」表示傾側貌。《廣雅．釋訓》：「崎嶇，傾側也。」王念孫疏證：「崎與嶇皆傾側貌也。」如戰國宋玉〈高唐賦〉：「磐石險峻，傾崎崖隤。」《楚辭．王褒〈九懷．昭世〉》：「忽反顧兮西囿，睹軫丘兮崎傾。」 「崎嶇」形容山路不平。《玉篇．山部》：「崎，崎嶇，山路不平。」如《潛夫論．浮侈》：「夫檽梓豫章，所出殊遠，又乃生於深山窮谷，經歷山岑，立千步之高，百丈之谿，傾倚險阻，崎嶇不便」東晉陶淵明〈歸去來辭〉：「既窈窕以尋壑，亦崎嶇而經丘。」參見「 嶇 」。 「崎嶇」引申表示困厄、經歷險阻。如《史記．燕召公世家》：「燕外迫蠻貉，內措齊、晉，崎嶇彊國之閒，最為弱小，幾滅者數矣。」唐代鮑防〈問津臺賦〉：「撫川陸之難險，憫人世之崎嶇。」
From the " mountain" to the " strange" sound. " Saki" means a sideways appearance. "Guang Ya. Shi Xun: "Rugged, leaning sideways." Wang Niansun's testimony: "Rough and rugged are sideways." Such as Song Yu of the Warring States Period (Gao Tang Fu): "The rock is steep and the cliffs are steep." Wang Bao "Rugged" describes uneven mountain roads. "Jade articles. "Mountain": "Rugged, rugged, uneven mountain roads." Such as "The Latent." "Floating": "The husband-in-law Ziyu Zhang, who traveled far and wide, was born in a deep mountain and poor valley, experienced mountain cens, and stood a thousand steps high, a stream of hundreds of meters, lean on dangers, rugged and inconvenient" Eastern Jin Tao Yuanming "Return Ci>: "It is not only slender to find trenches, but also rugged and passing through the hills." See " rugged". "Rugged" by extension means distress and experiencing difficulties. Such as "Historical Records. "Yanzhao Gong Family": "The Yan Zhaogong forced the wild raccoon outside, the internal measures were Qi, Jin, the rugged and strong country leisure, the weakest, and there are countless ones." Tang Dynasty Bao Fang "Inquiry about Jintai Fu": "Fuchuan Land Difficulties Risk, compassion for the ruggedness of the world."

Source glyph
Saki
Name meaning
: Rugged, uneven ground.
qí, qī
1) вм. 埼 (извилистый берег)
2) неровности, неровный; крутизна; обрыв; крутой, обрывистый, опасный
填崎塞畎 заровнять неровности и засыпать межевые тропинки
Radicals: 山, 大, 可  (mountain, big, lip-ring)
Meaning Mnemonic
On top of a big mountain, wearing a lip ring, you see a cape jutting out into the ocean. You’re wearing a lip ring because you’re a cool and edgy guy who likes to climb big mountains. From the top of the big mountain, you see a cape.
You’re tired from just climbing up the big mountain but the view is worth it. Feel the wind blustering around you as you take in the beautiful scenery, including the cape.
Reading Mnemonic
Atop the big mountain overlooking the cape, you start to play what you call hacky sacky (さき). Most people say hacky sack, but you’re edgy and cool and have a lip ring so you say sacky instead.
See yourself doing your hacky sacky thing on top of this big mountain. Concentrate to keep the hacky sacky in the air as it’s a long way down.
